tràth ann am madainn early of a morning –
Bha Màiri agus Seumas anns a’ mhonadh an dé. [...] Dh’ fhàg iad an taigh tràth anns a’ mhadainn.
Mary and James were on the moor yesterday. [...] They left home early in the morning. td. 76
Dh’éirich Màiri agus Calum tràth anns a’ mhadainn an diugh, oir bha iad ri dhol do’n sgoil. Dh’éirich Màiri aig deich mionaidean an déidh seachd, ach cha do dh’éirich Calum gus an robh e fichead mionaid gu ochd.
Mary and Malcolm rose early in the morning today, for they had to go to the school. Mary rose at ten minutes past seven, but Malcolm didn’t rise until it was twenty minutes to eight. td. 182–3

rach ... ann am madainn ... goes ... of a morning –
An do dh’fhan Màiri aig an taigh an diugh? Cha do dh’fhan. Chaidh Màiri do’n sgoil anns a’ mhadainn
Did Mary stay at home today? No, she didn’t. She went to school in the morning. td. 237–8
